066/**
067 *  Some I/O, file, file system and network related helper and convenience
068 *  methods.
069 *
070 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
071 *  @version $Id: IOUtils.java 1029 2022-03-15 00:29:29Z tquadrat $
072 *  @since 0.0.5
073 *
074 *  @UMLGraph.link
075 */
076@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IOUtils.java 1029 2022-03-15 00:29:29Z tquadrat $" )
077@UtilityClass
078public final class IOUtils
079{
080        /*---------------*\
081    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
082        \*---------------*/
083    /**
084     *  This implementation of an
085     *  {@link Appendable}
086     *  just swallows any data that is written to it, like the {@code /dev/null}
087     *  device of a Unix or Linux machine, or {@code NUL:} on Windows. This class
088     *  might be useful if an {@code Appendable} is required from the API, but
089     *  not applicable from the application logic.
090     *
091     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
092     *  @version $Id: IOUtils.java 1029 2022-03-15 00:29:29Z tquadrat $
093     *  @since 0.0.5
094     *
095     *  @UMLGraph.link
096     */
097    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicInnerClass" )
098    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IOUtils.java 1029 2022-03-15 00:29:29Z tquadrat $" )
099    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
100    public static class NullAppendable implements Appendable
101    {
102            /*---------*\
103        ====** Methods **==========================================================
104            \*---------*/
105        /**
106         *  Appends the specified character sequence to this Appendable. In fact,
107         *  it does nothing.
108         *
109         *  @param  csq {@inheritDoc}
110         */
111        @Override
112        public final Appendable append( final CharSequence csq ) throws IOException { return this; }
113
114        /**
115         *  Appends a subsequence of the specified character sequence to this
116         *  Appendable. In fact, it does nothing.
117         *
118         *  @param  csq {@inheritDoc}
119         */
120        @Override
121        public final Appendable append( final CharSequence csq, final int start, final int end ) throws IOException { return this; }
122
123        /**
124         *  Appends the specified character to this Appendable; in fact, it does
125         *  nothing.
126         *
127         *  @param  c   {@inheritDoc}
128         */
129        @Override
130        public final Appendable append( final char c ) throws IOException { return this; }
131    }
132    //  class NullAppendable
133
134    /**
135     *  The default file attributes.
136     *
137     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
138     *  @version $Id: IOUtils.java 1029 2022-03-15 00:29:29Z tquadrat $
139     *  @since 0.0.6
140     *
141     *  @UMLGraph.link
142     */
143    @SuppressWarnings( "UtilityClassCanBeEnum" )
144    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IOUtils.java 1029 2022-03-15 00:29:29Z tquadrat $" )
145    @UtilityClass
146    private static final class PosixPermissions
147    {
148            /*------------------------*\
149        ====** Static Initialisations **=======================================
150            \*------------------------*/
151        /**
152         *  The default attributes for a temporary file.
153         *
154         *  @since 0.0.6
155         */
156        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.6" )
157        static final FileAttribute<Set<PosixFilePermission>> tempFilePermissions;
158
159        /**
160         *  The default attributes for a temporary folder.
161         *
162         *  @since 0.0.6
163         */
164        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.6" )
165        static final FileAttribute<Set<PosixFilePermission>> tempDirPermissions;
166
167        static
168        {
169            tempFilePermissions = PosixFilePermissions.asFileAttribute( EnumSet.of( OWNER_READ, OWNER_WRITE ) );
170            tempDirPermissions = PosixFilePermissions.asFileAttribute( EnumSet.of( OWNER_READ, OWNER_WRITE, OWNER_EXECUTE ) );
171        }
172    }
173    //  class PosixPermissions
174
175        /*-----------*\
176    ====** Constants **========================================================
177        \*-----------*/
178    /**
179     *  Some methods in this class need a buffer; the size of this buffer is
180     *  defined here: {@value}.
181     */
182    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
183    public static final int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE = 8192;
184
185    /**
186     *  The flag that indicates if the default file systems is POSIX compliant.
187     *
188     *  @since 0.0.6
189     */
190    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
191    public static final boolean DEFAULT_FILESYSTEM_IS_POSIX_COMPLIANT = FileSystems.getDefault().supportedFileAttributeViews().contains("posix");
192
193        /*--------------*\
194    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
195        \*--------------*/
196    /**
197     *  No instance allowed for this class.
198     */
199    private IOUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( IOUtils.class ); }
200
201        /*---------*\
202    ====** Methods **==========================================================
203        \*---------*/
204    /**
205     *  Unconditionally closes an object instance of a class that implements
206     *  the interface
207     *  {@link AutoCloseable}.<br>
208     *  Equivalent to
209     *  {@link AutoCloseable#close()},
210     *  except any exceptions will be ignored. This is typically used in
211     *  {@code finally} blocks.<br>
212     *  <br>Even after the introduction of {@code try-with-resources} with
213     *  Java&nbsp;7, this method can be still helpful.
214     *
215     *  @param  c  The {@code AutoCloseable} instance to close, can be
216     *      {@code null} or already closed.
217     */
218    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
219    public static final void closeQuietly( final AutoCloseable c )
220    {
221        try
222        {
223            if( nonNull( c ) ) c.close();
224        }
225        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final Exception e ) { /* Deliberately ignored! */ }
226    }   //  closeQuietly()
227
228    /**
229     *  Creates a directory by creating all nonexistent parent directories
230     *  first. Unlike the
231     *  {@link #createDirectory(File,FileAttribute...)}
232     *  method, an exception is not thrown if the directory could not be
233     *  created because it already exists.<br>
234     *  <br>The {@code attributes} parameter is optional to set
235     *  {@linkplain FileAttribute file-attributes}
236     *  atomically when creating the non-existent directories. Each file
237     *  attribute is identified by its
238     *  {@linkplain FileAttribute#name name}.
239     *  If more than one attribute of the same name is included in the array
240     *  then all but the last occurrence is ignored.<br>
241     *  <br>If this method fails, then it may do so after creating some, but
242     *  not all, of the parent directories.
243     *
244     *  @param  dir The directory to create.
245     *  @param  attributes  An optional list of file attributes to set
246     *      atomically when creating the directory.
247     *  @return The directory.
248     *  @throws UnsupportedOperationException   The attributes array contains
249     *      an attribute that cannot be set atomically when creating the
250     *      directory.
251     *  @throws java.nio.file.FileAlreadyExistsException    The {@code dir}
252     *      exists but is not a directory <i>(optional specific exception)</i>.
253     *  @throws IOException An I/O error occurred.
254     *  @throws SecurityException   In the case a security manager is
255     *      installed, the
256     *      {@link SecurityManager#checkWrite(String) checkWrite()}
257     *      method is invoked prior to attempting to create a directory and its
258     *      {@link SecurityManager#checkRead(String) checkRead()}
259     *      is invoked for each parent directory that is checked. If
260     *      {@code dir} is not an absolute path then its
261     *      {@link File#getAbsoluteFile()}
262     *      method may need to be invoked to get its absolute path. This may
263     *      invoke the security manager's
264     *      {@link SecurityManager#checkPropertyAccess(String) checkPropertyAccess()}
265     *      method to check access to the system property {@code user.dir}.
266     *
267     *  @see Files#createDirectories(Path, FileAttribute...)
268     *  @see File#mkdirs()
269     *
270     *  @since 0.0.6
271     */
272    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
273    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
274    public static final File createDirectories( final File dir, final FileAttribute<?>... attributes ) throws IOException
275    {
276        final var path = Files.createDirectories( requireNonNullArgument( dir, "dir" ).toPath(), requireNonNullArgument( attributes, "attributes" ) );
277        final var retValue = path.toFile();
278
279        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
280        return retValue;
281    }   //  createDirectories()
282
283    /**
284     *  Creates a new directory. The check for the existence of the file and
285     *  the creation of the directory if it does not exist are a single
286     *  operation that is atomic with respect to all other filesystem
287     *  activities that might affect the directory. The
288     *  {@link #createDirectories(File, FileAttribute...) createDirectories()}
289     *  method should be used where it is required to create all nonexistent
290     *  parent directories first.<br>
291     *  <br>The {@code attributes} parameter is optional to set
292     *  {@linkplain FileAttribute file-attributes}
293     *  atomically when creating the directory. Each attribute is identified by
294     *  its
295     *  {@linkplain FileAttribute#name name}.
296     *  If more than one attribute of the same name is included in the array
297     *  then all but the last occurrence is ignored.
298     *
299     *  @param  dir The directory to create.
300     *  @param  attributes  An optional list of file attributes to set
301     *      atomically when creating the directory
302     *  @return The directory.
303     *  @throws UnsupportedOperationException   The attributes array contains
304     *      an attribute that cannot be set atomically when creating the
305     *      directory.
306     *  @throws java.nio.file.FileAlreadyExistsException    A directory could
307     *      not otherwise be created because a file of that name already exists
308     *      <i>(optional specific exception)</i>.
309     *  @throws IOException An I/O error occurred or the parent directory does
310     *      not exist.
311     *  @throws SecurityException   In the case a security manager is
312     *      installed, the
313     *      {@link SecurityManager#checkWrite(String) checkWrite()}
314     *      method is invoked to check write access to the new directory.
315     *
316     *  @since 0.0.6
317     */
318    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
319    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
320    public static File createDirectory( final File dir, final FileAttribute<?>... attributes ) throws IOException
321    {
322        final var path = Files.createDirectory( requireNonNullArgument( dir, "dir" ).toPath(), requireNonNullArgument( attributes, "attributes" ) );
323        final var retValue = path.toFile();
324
325        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
326        return retValue;
327    }   //  createDirectory()
328
329    /**
330     *  Creates a directory named after the account name of the current user in
331     *  the default {@code temp} folder, determined by the system property
332     *  {@value org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#PROPERTY_TEMPFOLDER}.<br>
333     *  <br>The access rights are set for the current user only (for UNIX, it
334     *  would be 700).<br>
335     *  <br>The new directory will <i>not</i> be removed automatically after
336     *  program termination.<br>
337     *  <br>The class
338     *  {@link File}
339     *  provides a static method
340     *  {@link File#createTempFile(String, String) createTempFile()}
341     *  that creates a temporary file in the default temporary folder. As this
342     *  may be not a problem on a single-user Windows system with default
343     *  configuration, it will cause security problems on UNIX-like systems.
344     *  Therefore, it is recommended, to use
345     *  {@link File#createTempFile(String, String, File)}
346     *  instead, like this:
347     *  <pre><code>File tempFile = File.createTempFile( "PREFIX", "EXT", createTempDirectory() );</code></pre>
348     *  This will guarantee that the temporary files cannot be read by
349     *  other users.
350     *
351     *  @return The new temporary directory; it is guaranteed that the
352     *      directory exists after the call to this method returned.
353     *  @throws IOException Something has gone wrong.
354     *
355     *  @since 0.0.6
356     */
357    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
358    public static File createTempDirectory() throws IOException
359    {
360        //---* Create the file object for the temp directory *-----------------
361        final var tempDir = new File( getProperty( PROPERTY_TEMPFOLDER ) );
362        final var userTempDir = new File( tempDir, getProperty( PROPERTY_USER_NAME ) );
363
364        //---* Get the file attributes *---------------------------------------
365        final FileAttribute<?> [] attributes = DEFAULT_FILESYSTEM_IS_POSIX_COMPLIANT ? new FileAttribute [] {PosixPermissions.tempDirPermissions} : new FileAttribute [0];
366
367        //---* Create the directory *------------------------------------------
368        final var retValue = createDirectories( userTempDir, attributes );
369
370        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
371        return retValue;
372    }   //  createTempDirectory()
373
374    /**
375     *  Creates a new directory in the specified directory, using the given
376     *  prefix to generate its name.<br>
377     *  <br>The details as to how the name of the directory is constructed is
378     *  implementation dependent and therefore not specified. Where possible
379     *  the {@code prefix} is used to construct candidate names.<br>
380     *  <br>The {@code attributes} parameter is optional to set
381     *  {@linkplain FileAttribute file-attributes}
382     *  atomically when creating the directory. Each attribute is identified by
383     *  its
384     *  {@linkplain FileAttribute#name() name}.
385     *  If more than one attribute of the same name is included in the array
386     *  then all but the last occurrence is ignored.
387     *
388     *  @param  dir The directory in which to create the temporary directory.
389     *  @param  prefix  The prefix string to be used in generating the
390     *      directory's name; may be {@code null}.
391     *  @param  attributes  An optional list of file attributes to set
392     *      atomically when creating the directory.
393     *  @return The path to the newly created directory that did not exist
394     *      before this method was invoked.
395     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The prefix cannot be used to
396     *      generate a candidate directory name.
397     *  @throws UnsupportedOperationException   The attributes array contains
398     *      an attribute that cannot be set atomically when creating the
399     *      directory.
400     *  @throws IOException An I/O error occurs or {@code dir} does not exist.
401     *  @throws SecurityException   In the case a security manager is
402     *      installed, the
403     *      {@link SecurityManager#checkWrite(String) checkWrite()}
404     *      method is invoked to check write access when creating the
405     *      directory.
406     *
407     *  @see Files#createTempDirectory(Path, String, FileAttribute...)
408     *
409     *  @since 0.0.6
410     */
411    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
412    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
413    public static Path createTempDirectory( final File dir, final String prefix, final FileAttribute<?>... attributes ) throws IOException
414    {
415        return Files.createTempDirectory( requireNonNullArgument( dir, "dir" ).toPath(), prefix, requireNonNullArgument( attributes, "attributes" ) );
416    }   //  createTempDirectory()
417
418    /**
419     *  Creates a new directory in the default temporary-file directory, using
420     *  the given prefix to generate its name.<br>
421     *  <br>This method works in exactly the manner specified by
422     *  {@link #createTempDirectory(File,String,FileAttribute[])}
423     *  method for the case that the {@code dir} parameter is the
424     *  temporary-file directory.
425     *
426     *  @param  prefix  The prefix string to be used in generating the
427     *      directory's name; may be {@code null}.
428     *  @param  attributes  An optional list of file attributes to set
429     *      atomically when creating the directory.
430     *  @return The
431     *      {@link File}
432     *      instance to the newly created directory that did not exist before
433     *      this method was invoked.
434     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The prefix cannot be used to
435     *      generate a candidate directory name.
436     *  @throws UnsupportedOperationException   The {@code attributes} array
437     *      contains an attribute that cannot be set atomically when creating
438     *      the directory.
439     *  @throws IOException An I/O error occurred or the temporary-file
440     *      directory does not exist.
441     *  @throws SecurityException   In the case a security manager is
442     *      installed, the
443     *      {@link SecurityManager#checkWrite(String) checkWrite()}
444     *      method is invoked to check write access when creating the
445     *      directory.
446     *
447     *  @see Files#createTempDirectory(String, FileAttribute...)
448     *
449     *  @since 0.0.6
450     */
451    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
452    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
453    public static File createTempDirectory( final String prefix, final FileAttribute<?>... attributes ) throws IOException
454    {
455        final var path = Files.createTempDirectory( prefix, requireNonNullArgument( attributes, "attributes" ) );
456        final var retValue = path.toFile();
457
458        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
459        return retValue;
460    }   //  createTempDirectory()
461
462    /**
463     *  <p>{@summary Deletes the folder (or file) that is determined by the
464     *  given
465     *  {@link Path}
466     *  instance.} If the argument denotes a directory, the method will remove
467     *  its contents first, recursively.</p>
468     *
469     *  @param  folder  The folder to remove; despite the name of the argument
470     *      and the method, this can be also a plain file.
471     *  @throws IOException A problem occurred when deleting the {@code Path}.
472     */
473    public static final void deleteFolder( final Path folder ) throws IOException
474    {
475        walkFileTree( requireNonNullArgument( folder, "folder" ), new SimpleFileVisitor<>()
476        {
477            /**
478             * {@inheritDoc}
479             */
480            @Override
481            public final FileVisitResult postVisitDirectory( final Path directory, final IOException exception ) throws IOException
482            {
483                try
484                {
485                    delete( directory );
486                }
487                catch( IOException e )
488                {
489                    if( nonNull( exception ) ) e.addSuppressed( exception );
490                    throw e;
491                }
492
493                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
494                return CONTINUE;
495            }   //  postVisitDirectory()
496
497            /**
498             * {@inheritDoc}
499             */
500            @Override
501            public final FileVisitResult visitFile( final Path file, final BasicFileAttributes attributes ) throws IOException
502            {
503                delete( file );
504
505                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
506                return CONTINUE;
507            }   //  visitFile()
508        } );
509    }   //  deleteFolder()
510
511    /**
512     *  <p>{@summary Deletes the folder (or file) that is determined by the
513     *  given
514     *  {@link File}.
515     *  instance.} If the argument denotes a directory, the method will remove
516     *  its contents first, recursively.</p>
517     *  <p>Calls
518     *  {@link #deleteFolder(Path)}
519     *  internally.</p>
520     *
521     *  @param  folder  The folder to remove; despite the name of the argument
522     *      and the method, this can be also a plain file.
523     *  @throws IOException A problem occurred when deleting the {@code Path}.
524     */
525    public static final void deleteFolder( final File folder ) throws IOException
526    {
527        deleteFolder( requireNonNullArgument( folder, "folder" ).toPath() );
528    }   //  deleteFolder()
529
530    /**
531     *  <p>{@summary Calculates the check sum for the given file, using the
532     *  algorithm with the given name.}</p>
533     *  <p>If the name is one of</p>
534     *  <ul>
535     *      <li>CRC32</li>
536     *      <li>Adler32</li>
537     *  </ul>
538     *  <p>the method uses
539     *  {@link java.util.zip.CRC32}
540     *  or
541     *  {@link java.util.zip.Adler32}
542     *  for the calculation, any other name is taken as the name for a
543     *  {@linkplain MessageDigest};
544     *  all JVMs know</p>
545     *  <ul>
546     *      <li>MD5</li>
547     *      <li>SHA1</li>
548     *  </ul>
549     *  <p>others can be added by installing additional
550     *  {@linkplain java.security.Provider security providers}.</p>
551     *  <p>This method calls
552     *  {@link #determineCheckSum(Path, String)}
553     *  internally.</p>
554     *
555     *  @param  file    The file to process.
556     *  @param  algorithm   The name for the algorithm to use for the check sum
557     *      calculation.
558     *  @return The check sum as a hex string.
559     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
560     *  @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException    The provided algorithm does not
561     *      exist or the provider for it is not installed properly.
562     */
563    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
564    public static final String determineCheckSum( final File file, final String algorithm ) throws IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
565    {
566        final var retValue = determineCheckSum( requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" ).toPath(), algorithm );
567
568        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
569        return retValue;
570    }   //  determineCheckSum()
571
572    /**
573     *  <p>{@summary Calculates the check sum for the given file, using the
574     *  algorithm with the given name.}</p>
575     *  <p>If the name is one of</p>
576     *  <ul>
577     *      <li>CRC32</li>
578     *      <li>Adler32</li>
579     *  </ul>
580     *  <p>the method uses
581     *  {@link java.util.zip.CRC32}
582     *  or
583     *  {@link java.util.zip.Adler32}
584     *  for the calculation, any other name is taken as the name for a
585     *  {@linkplain MessageDigest};
586     *  all JVMs know</p>
587     *  <ul>
588     *      <li>MD5</li>
589     *      <li>SHA1</li>
590     *  </ul>
591     *  <p>others can be added by installing additional
592     *  {@linkplain java.security.Provider security providers}.</p>
593     *
594     *  @param  file    The file to process.
595     *  @param  algorithm   The name for the algorithm to use for the check sum
596     *      calculation.
597     *  @return The check sum as a hex string.
598     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
599     *  @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException    The provided algorithm does not
600     *      exist or the provider for it is not installed properly.
601     */
602    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
603    public static final String determineCheckSum( final Path file, final String algorithm ) throws IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
604    {
605        final var retValue = switch( requireNotEmptyArgument( algorithm, "algorithm" ) )
606        {
607            case "Adler32" -> format( "%Xd", determineCheckSum( file, new Adler32() ) );
608            case "CRC32" -> format( "%Xd", determineCheckSum( file, new CRC32() ) );
609            default -> {
610                final var messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance( algorithm );
611                yield HexFormat.of()
612                    .withUpperCase()
613                    .formatHex( determineCheckSum( file, messageDigest ) );
614            }
615        };
616
617        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
618        return retValue;
619    }   //  determineCheckSum()
620
621    /**
622     *  Calculates the check sum for the given file, using provided check sum
623     *  algorithm implementation.
624     *
625     *  @param  file    The file to process.
626     *  @param  algorithm   The check sum algorithm to use for the check sum
627     *      calculation.
628     *  @return The check sum.
629     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
630     */
631    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
632    public static final long determineCheckSum( final File file, final Checksum algorithm ) throws IOException
633    {
634        final var retValue = determineCheckSum( requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" ).toPath(), algorithm );
635
636        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
637        return retValue;
638    }   //  determineCheckSum()
639
640    /**
641     *  Calculates the check sum for the given file, using provided check sum
642     *  algorithm implementation.
643     *
644     *  @param  file    The file to process.
645     *  @param  algorithm   The check sum algorithm to use for the check sum
646     *      calculation.
647     *  @return The check sum.
648     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
649     */
650    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
651    public static final long determineCheckSum( final Path file, final Checksum algorithm ) throws IOException
652    {
653        requireNonNullArgument( algorithm, "algorithm" ).reset();
654        try( final var inputStream = Files.newInputStream( requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" ), READ ) )
655        {
656            final var buffer = new byte [DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE];
657            var readBytes = 0;
658            while( (readBytes = inputStream.read( buffer )) > 0 )
659            {
660                algorithm.update( buffer, 0, readBytes );
661            }
662        }
663        final var retValue = algorithm.getValue();
664
665        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
666        return retValue;
667    }   //  determineCheckSum()
668
669    /**
670     *  Calculates the check sum for the given file, using the provided
671     *  {@link MessageDigest}.
672     *
673     *  @param  file    The file to process.
674     *  @param  algorithm   The {@code MessageDigest} to use for the check sum
675     *      calculation.
676     *  @return The check sum as a byte array.
677     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
678     */
679    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
680    public static final byte [] determineCheckSum( final File file, final MessageDigest algorithm ) throws IOException
681    {
682        final var retValue = determineCheckSum( requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" ).toPath(), algorithm );
683
684        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
685        return retValue;
686    }   //  determineCheckSum()
687
688    /**
689     *  Calculates the check sum for the given file, using the provided
690     *  {@link MessageDigest}.
691     *
692     *  @param  file    The file to process.
693     *  @param  algorithm   The {@code MessageDigest} to use for the check sum
694     *      calculation.
695     *  @return The check sum as a byte array.
696     *  @throws IOException Problems to process the file.
697     */
698    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
699    public static final byte [] determineCheckSum( final Path file, final MessageDigest algorithm ) throws IOException
700    {
701        requireNonNullArgument( algorithm, "algorithm" ).reset();
702        try( final var inputStream = Files.newInputStream( requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" ), READ ) )
703        {
704            final var buffer = new byte [DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE];
705            var readBytes = 0;
706            while( (readBytes = inputStream.read( buffer )) > 0 )
707            {
708                algorithm.update( buffer, 0, readBytes );
709            }
710        }
711        final var retValue = algorithm.digest();
712
713        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
714        return retValue;
715    }   //  determineCheckSum()
716
717    /**
718     *  Returns an
719     *  {@link Appendable}
720     *  that just swallows any data that is written to it, like the
721     *  {@code /dev/null} device of a Unix or Linux machine, or {@code NUL:}
722     *  on Windows.
723     *
724     *  @return A null appendable.
725     *
726     *  @see NullAppendable
727     */
728    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
729    public static final Appendable getNullAppendable() { return new NullAppendable(); }
730
731    /**
732     *  <p>{@summary Returns
733     *  {@link System#out}
734     *  with a non-functional
735     *  {@link OutputStream#close()}
736     *  method.}</p>
737     *  <p>Assume the following scenario:</p>
738     *  <pre><code>  &hellip;
739     *  Optional&lt;File&gt; outputFile = &hellip;
740     *  &hellip;
741     *  PrintStream outputStream = outputFile.isPresent() ? new PrintStream( new FileOutputStream( outputFile.get() ) ) : IOUtils.getUncloseableOut();
742     *  try( outputStream )
743     *  {
744     *      &#47;**
745     *       * Print something ...
746     *       *&#47;
747     *       &hellip;
748     *  }
749     *  &hellip;</code></pre>
750     *  <p>The output stream will be close at the end of the {@code try} block;
751     *  this is desired in case of a
752     *  {@link java.io.FileOutputStream FileOutputStream},
753     *  but totally not wanted if the output stream is {@code System.out}.</p>
754     *
755     *  @return {@code System.out} without the {@code close()} method.
756     */
757    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
758    public static final PrintStream getUncloseableOut()
759    {
760        final var retValue = new PrintStream( out )
761        {
762            /**
763             *  {@inheritDoc}
764             */
765            @Override
766            public final void close() { /* Does nothing */ }
767        };
768
769        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
770        return retValue;
771    }   //  getUncloseableOut()
772
773    /**
774     *  <p>{@summary Reads the complete content of the provided
775     *  {@link Reader}
776     *  into a
777     *  {@link String}.}</p>
778     *  <p>Obviously this method is feasible only for files with a limited
779     *  size.</p>
780     *
781     *  @param  reader  The {@code Reader} instance.
782     *  @return The content of the provided {@code Reader}.
783     *  @throws IOException Problems on reading from the {@code Reader}.
784     */
785    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
786    public static final String loadToString( final Reader reader ) throws IOException
787    {
788        final var builder = new StringBuilder( DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE );
789        final var buffer = new char [DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE];
790        var bytesRead = requireNonNullArgument( reader, "reader" ).read( buffer );
791        while( bytesRead > 0 )
792        {
793            builder.append( buffer, 0, bytesRead );
794            bytesRead = reader.read( buffer );
795        }
796        final var retValue = builder.toString();
797
798        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
799        return retValue;
800    }   //  loadToString()
801}
802//  class IOUtils
803
804/*
805 *  End of File
806 */
